direction.raw_text: reluctantly, under the urging of her friend behind the video lens - - sets the scene.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi... My name is Mary O'Reilly O'Toole O'Shea and...over there is the island my friend Muffy owns... It's spring break... and she's invited us over for the weekend, and we're waiting for the ferry now to take us there... (blushing, mortified to cameraman) I don't know what else to say!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell us something about yourself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something about myself? Oh, Gee... (composing herself, earnestly) Well, I want to work with handicapped children... My parents are my best Friends... Next semester I start convent school, and I... fuck on the first date. O.S. her friends explode with LAUGHTER. Brassy former deb NIKKI BRASHEARS gives us a big, wet wink, dropping the act.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: April Fool...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoo! Outrageous woman! Nikki, you are my kind o' gal! He PANS THE CAMERA over to KIT-- a pretty, unaffected, natural beauty, bright and very much aware.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, Kit, how about you? Kit waves him off, laughing in spite of herself. She's got nothing to say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon , Arch? Skip? He PANS over to the other two college boys on the dock here - ARCH, a big, good-natured, easygoing WASP jock (rugby and crew); and SKIP, Mr. Preppy, the perfect image of the lazy spoiled, indulged, and reckless upper-crust kid. Skip also happens to be Muffy's cousin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (ponders it with due consideration) Yeah, sure... I fuck on the first date... Skip cracks up. Arch's laughter follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Where's Rob? Chaz QUICK-PANS the camera back to Kit, following the action.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (teasing, with innuendo) Yeah, Kit, where is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (MORE TEASING) Oh, Kit... Concerned, Kit keeps her humor anyway, waving the lens away again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, c'mon, Chaz, give me some room, will you? He does, finally shutting down the videopak. The image reverts to FILM again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looks at her, persisting) Well?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : The driver -- a still great-looking, turned-out Fairfield County-type
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and the passenger, ROB FERRIS a cleancut, goodlooking, 20 year old public school grad sit in uncomfortable silence on opposite ends of the front seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (gestures, awkwardly) Here'll be fine, thanks...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Volvo wagon pulls over. Rob drags out his daypack, too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks... for the lift, I mean...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles, no reason for disappointment) It was a real lift for me, too, hon. A late model Detroit sedan slows at the intersection, turning off the highway to take the junction in the direction Rob is going. A road sign indicates: "BAR HARBOR MOUNT DESERT" in another direction. Rob hefts his gear, hurrying to flag the sedan. The Volvo wagon continues on, braking for the next undergraduate male hitchhiking down the road.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JOHN HOUSE- DAY CLOSE ON a wall calendar. A HAND reaches INTO FRAME, tearing off
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to begin "APRIL".
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: N TO REVEAL CLARA, the middle-aged housekeeper and offseason caretaker for the house. With her overcoat and purse on one arm, she drops the "MARCH" calendar page in a wastebasket, then crosses to the pantry where a door and wooden steps lead down to the basement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The rooms are all in order, double- and triple-checked, and I'm on my way... She hears a CLATTER from down below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JOHN drags a woman's body across the floor. The arm comes off in her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Need any help down there? Clara comes clopping down the steps. Muffy turns, the mannequin's arm still in her hand. Old workclothes and a head kerchief take the place of Muffy's normally impeccable prep Seven Sisters outfit (including the regulation penny loafers) in all this dust. Early 20's, pretty in an off-beat sort of way, Muffy is every inch a blue-blood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (puffing with the effort) No, Clara, thanks. Just trying some last minute straightening down here... god, I don't think I've ever worked so hard in my life...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure you don't want me to stay? There's nobody gonna be around here to help till first ferry back Monday, y'know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (continuing with her work) Nope, you're a peach, Clara. But this one's mine. I told my father I'd do it, and I will. My way. I don't want him to have any excuses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (dubiously , turning to go) All right, then. Have a nice party.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a buoyant laugh) Nice? It has to be better than nice... it's gotta be bloody unforgettable! Clara climbs the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good luck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bye, Clara. See you Monday. Soon there's the upstairs SOUND of the kitchen door closing behind Clara. Muffy finally props the mannequin, clearing away the remaining clutter. She goes to open a basement window for ventilation. It is a ground-level transom, hinged at the top. Through it Clara is visible departing the grounds. Then Muffy hears a DRIPPING. She turns, hesitating, and follows the sounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Part of the basement, an old washroom and more, with tub, slop sink and large incinerator. Muffy enters, pulling the chain on the bare, overhead bulb. It illuminates the room, and the tub underneath -- slightly rusty at the drain, but otherwise spotless -- and the slowly dripping faucet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the videocameraman and the only member of the group we haven't seen till now, is the first to spot the ferry approaching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here she comes... He's a real hi-tech freak and Ivy League wiseass, a free spirit in neo-punk neck curl and button-down shirt. He shoulders his lightweight videopak again, taping it. Arch and Skip watch with him from the end of the pier. But Kit and Nikki, waiting nearer the office, are distracted by the SOUND of an arriving car.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not Rob, though. It's NAN, another newcomer. She pulls her car next to the others in the gravel lot behind the landing office and - gets out quickly, dragging a hefty suitcase out of the back seat. She is an unfamiliar face to Kit and Nikki --a shy, earnest, small-town girl, overdressed for the occasion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi... is this the ferry to the St. John house?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Any second now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, thank goodness ! I didn't know if I was on the right road... Kit smiles welcome, lending a hand as Nan struggles the bag up the ramp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. Kit Graham... Nikki Brashears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nan Youngblood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (needling, about the suitcase) Planning on staying a while?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (flushes, embarrassed) Oh, no... just some work for finals, when we get back... you don't know how far behind I am... Arch outhustles Chaz for her bag. Her simple attractiveness exerts an appeal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi. Arch Cummings . I've seen you around. Jewett Hall, right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chaz Vyshinsky. You got great legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pointed1y, reminds him) Chaz, Arch already has her bag. Meaning, Chaz is Nikki's man, especially for this weekend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (volunteering, happily) Well, I only met Muffy this term in Drama Society . I volunteered to do their costumes... I like to sew... Did you see her in Ghosts? She's so talented. She was wonderful!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Nan, approvingly; in greeting) Congratulations, on finding your way. The landing BUMPS, the ferry touches down. They look up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stand clear! The large, raw-boned FERRYMAN holds open the wooden stile for the one and only passenger from the island  Clara -- to disembark. Clara passes them , giving first Skip and then the others a look, shaking her head in sad appraisal.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont.) (GROWLS) Ok, let's go. It's not the friendliest greeting in the world. The ferryman keeps the stile open for them to board singly. There is also a younger assistant on board -- BUCK, a pleasant, openfaced townie in his 20s.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont.) To the rear. Outa the operator's way. Nikki clutches at Skip's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is it? No going back? Trapped for days on an island where men are men, and women oughta know better?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Try to control yourself, Sister O'Toole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could tie me in chains... Chaz boards, passing Buck, the assistant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a low whisper) Your fly's open, and your Hostess Twinkie's hanging out... The assistant gapes, falling for it, groping his fly. Which is closed, of course. He looks up, grinning. Chaz kisses him on the cheek, winks and moves on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sh -i-i-t... Kit is hanging back on the dock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on if you're coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me. But we're still waiting for somebody -- FERRYMAN (GRUFFLY) It's Friday. My last run of the week. I don't get paid overtime.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But you've got to wait. They said it's the only way over. If he misses this... Arch WHISTLES loudly, seeing and alerting them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THEIR POV A late model Detroit sedan (the one we saw earlier turning off the highway) pulls to a fast stop in the lot. Rob hurries out; a CHEER comes up from the group on the ferry. Kit closes her eyes in relief. Rob comes hurrying up the ramp.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...followed closely by HARVEY 'HAL' EDISON, JR.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait up! Harvey is the driver of the sedan, and after he carefully locks up, he comes running with his bag, too. He is a rangy, straight-arrow Ivy League farmboy from the Border South, and he's the last of Muffy's invited guests. He also, somewhat incongruously, sports a Bruce Springsteen badge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Kit, kissing her) Sorry... Nik, Chaz... (to Skip and Nan whom he doesn't know) Rob Ferris... They return greetings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi! Harvey 'Hal' Edison, Jr., but please call me Hal. Only my folks call me Harve... and I can't stand it. Boy, this sure is a pretty spot. Stylistically, he's a Martian. Chaz stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're friends with... Muffy St. John?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure am. We sit together in Econ 345. I let her copy my marginal utility curves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I get it. That's a joke. Preppy Skip adds his greeting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (an ironical nod) Harve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (correcting him, blithely) Hal... (noticing interest his badge) Springsteen, he's still the Boss!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ok, c'mon, I don't have all day. He slams the stile down after Harvey, the last to board, and gets busy with the stubborn motor. His assistant helps. Chaz tapes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (enthusiastically, putting down his fear)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: all buddies?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Except for Skip and Nan. Them we just met.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But we will be.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Watch what you say around him, though. He's Muffy's cousin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (tickled, to Skip) No kiddin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Distant. Over the horizon. Otherwise, I wouldn't be invited... (frowns, tellingly) Old money never mixes family with friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is true. For as long as I've known her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To protect her family, I guess.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To keep her friends. He turns to Arch, holds up his hand, and CLICK, a switchblade opens into the lens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont.) Choose your weapons, big guy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (nervously, a laugh) Hey, what's this...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You up for a game of stretch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (still taping, to Skip) Your fly's open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eat it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (undaunted, to Rob) Your fly's open. (SHRUGS) Ok, so don't believe me. He keeps the tape rolling. Rob discreetly looks down. His fly is open. Kit looks at him dubiously. Rob zips. Chaz beams, getting it all for posterity. The engine finally engages. The ferry lurches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles weakly to Kit) We're off! They are indeed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ferry pulls away from the mainland.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: R ANGLE. The sturdy, barge like ship craft makes progress. The Ferryman and Buck remain at the stern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - THE DECK As Skip's knife flies INTO FRAME, it bites into the boards and holds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: at their game. Arch stretches, can't reach the knife, and topples over. Skip hoots triumphantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First round, the champ!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki, much to her chagrin, finds herself the object of Harvey's attentions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Y'know what I find amazin'? Muffy's her real name. I mean, I'm Harvey, but they call me Hal, so I thought, 'Muffy', it must stand for something... Muffin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muffers, Moffo, Muff-child , Muffin' stuff, the Muffster...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I bet you're her oldest friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Actually, she's three months older than I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I mean.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey... are you planning a career in politics when you grow up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've given it some thought. Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, just a hunch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First, though, I'm hopin' to interview with her daddy's company, Southern Regional Sales, next year before graduation... Y'know, he's worth more'n 50 mill over the counter! She just stares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: UP - THE KNIFE digging into the deck again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) Jesus...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and SKIP The knife is at an impossible distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go for it, big fella. Arch swallows his pride and makes a hopeless attempt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: fastens onto Nan, immersed in one of her books. He carries his own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sitting beside her) Whatcha readin'?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Milton. Paradise Lost. For Professor Russo's course on the English epic... It's a shame. It's a dying form. Not too many people read it nowadays, even in college. What's yours?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suck and fuck. Naked bodies writhing in heat. Women with their tongues sticking out in desparate desire... Nan tries to control her reaction to his stack of graphic pornographic video catalogues and magazines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The origins of American pornographic film. I'm taking an independent study this term. (the passion and commitment show) My advisor's really behind me on it. We're not gonna be sheltered college kids all our lives. Someday I'm gonna have kids -- you're gonna have kids  and someday that kid's gonna come up to me and say, 'God, Dad, porn's really a major part of our lives. You were there, how'd it get started?' I wanna be able to answer their questions. (SMILES) Besides, it's research I can do by myself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They keep their voices low.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's not my point -- ROB You don't want me to hitch, you want me to buy a car. OK, but I'm a state university boy, I don't have the perks like some of you private college kids do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, c'mon, don't pull that. Rob just drops his arms in frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont.) I mean, it may show something about your attitude toward me, always being late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kit... Arch's voice interrupts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (annoyed, loudly, overriding the other conversations) Hey, I'm really not interested anymore -- SKIP C'mon, just one more The others look up at the interruption.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Arch pushes the knife back into Skip's hand, tired of playing knife- toss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I said, enough's enough--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One more try, double or nothing. He flips the knife to Arch, handle first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C'mon, give it a fuckin' rest! He flips it back hard. Something happens. Skip looks up stunned. Arch's voice catches in his throat in horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skip stares back, disbelieving, looking down and pulling his hand away from his chest, where the blood begins to seep and the jackknife sticks out, buried hilt-deep between his ribs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, fuck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nan screams. Skip stumbles, teetering there at the edge of the ferry. Rob and Chaz leap to their feet. The ferrymen both look up in disbelief. Arch steps forward to help. But Skip, weaving, topples and splashes overboard. He goes under.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (panicked, hurrying to the side) I'll get him, I'll get him! But he stops just at the edge of the ferry, immobilized by fear. Rob rushes forward, with Chaz in reserve, pulling Arch out of the way. But Buck, the assistant ferryman, pre-empts them all, diving in. Arch, frozen, watches from the deck with the others. Buck resurfaces, but without any sign of Skip. Rob doesn't wait any longer. He pulls off his shoes and dives in. Chaz gets ready to follow suit. The panic mounts. Suddenly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hi, this what you're looking for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skip pulls himself up, dripping, on the other side of the ferry. He holds up the knife -- and the padded sash beneath his shirt he used to imbed the knife -- and grins from ear to ear. The others stare, totally freaked. Arch lets go, jumping in the air. Rob and Buck surface, to see as well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We got 'em! Whoo-ee, did we nail 'em!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (as it dawns, to Skip) April Fools... you crazy jerks. You crazy motherfuckin' jerks... somebody could've gotten hurt out there! Relief descends. Rob isn't laughing. But nobody's more impressed than assistant Buck, still treading water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You maniacs... you almost gave us a heart attack! Kit glowers at them and gives Rob a hand to get out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, at least we don't go in for this your-shoelaceis-untied crap!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (dripping, to Arch and Skip) I owe you one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (smiles, to Buck in the water) How's it goin' out there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was great!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was really counting on these other turkeys to save my ass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, too bad. Skip extends a hand to Buck to help him out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry about that. But Buck's in no hurry. The ferryman steps forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (unamused, to Buck) Ok, c'mon, get out. They are approaching the landing dock on the island.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) (to Buck, gruffly) C'mon I'm gonna need some help here. Buck obeys, but his way, enjoying it, ducking under the craft to swim to the other side to help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And watch out for the wire! Too late. There's a sickening THUMP I The young assistant suddenly breaks the surface qf the water, panicked and stunned, gasping for air. It happens too fast for any of them to do anything. Buck thrashes, dazed, off-balance, falling back into the path of the ferry as it glides toward the landing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buck, look out--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, shit... The ferryman grabs the controls, but it can't help. The ferry, unstoppable, plows into Buck, pinning him against one of the piers. Buck screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buck! The ferryman rushes forward to help. For a moment the others are spared the horror of it as the Ferryman's back blocks their view. But then Buck, thrashing in the water, tears himself, loose, screaming and bobbing. up, his head and torso covered in blood, the side of his face and his shoulder hideously deformed. It is awful. It is ghastly. And it is unforgettable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, god!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the middle-aged township constable, hears the cries and the screams. He drops what he's doing in his outboard and comes running.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ferryman jumps into the shallow water, pulling Buck onto shore. Rob, Chaz and Arch jump after to help, but the ferryman pushes them angrily away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get away from him! Buck is hysterical. The gashes of torn flesh seem to drip from his skull. Seeing Rob and the others, he screams, lunging vainly at them in agony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They did it... them!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy Buck... it's OK... OK... There's time for Later... easy... But it's hard for him to restrain his own rage. Constable Potter arrives, throwing the ferryman a towel to use. The ferryman catches it, pressing it against Buck's torn face. One maddened, glaring eye still stares out hideously at the group.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get him to the hospital, Cal! Take my boat! He helps the ferryman lift Buck. But the powerful ferryman needs no further help, carrying Buck to the Constable's motorboat moored nearby, laying Buck in, untying the line and pulling the motor to life. Buck continues to shriek, terrifyingly. The ferryman cast one last glance back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The SOUND of the motorboat fades away. Potter turns back to the stunned group, eyeing them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right... Let's have it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muffy drives up. She slows, seeing, through the windshield the somber scene at the pier... her friends in troubled conversation with Constable Potter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muffy gets out, parking the new van beside an old island pick-up which is kept at the dock. She's clean, and dressed in her more usual preppy garb. She approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's going on? Sam... what's wrong?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tricks. Pranks. Better ask your friends... Buck's been hurt. 'Cal just took him on over to the mainland. Just lucky I was here... She returns his stare in dread silence. He boards the ferry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) I came over to check on a report of some unauthorized activity in the area... Your dad around? She startles, the question 50 unanticipated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, he's in Sutton Place. Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No word from him, or anybody else?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No... He tries the engine. Nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just like I thought. . Burned out. Worthless... He steps back onto the shore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) I'll have to borrow your outboard to get back to shore.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We keep all the keys on the board in the kitchen, but I think there's an extra one underneath the cushion there. She points to the boat seat. Potter is much obliged.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the others, sternly) I'm glad you're stuck here, all o' you. If there's anvthin' else, or anything happens to Buck... I want to know where to find you. The van moves slowly along a narrow road through the forest. From what we can see of its occupants, the mood is pretty grim. Behind it, the old island pick-up truck follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob drives with Kit and Skip beside him in the cab. Nobody says anything . Skip is off somewhere in his own private hell. Finally he reaches over to roll down his window, but the handle rotates uselessly in his grip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These goddamn windows! He starts banging violently on the door, on the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They've never been fixed...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, Skip, it wasn't your fault. It was an accident. You didn't know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sure. He leaves off his banging. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What a way to start a weekend, huh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muffy. Nothing bad ever happens to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JOHN HOUSE. DAY. It is a truly grand affair, two stories at least, rambling and picture-perfect with extensive tended grounds, garage, and outbuildings. Muffy gets out first, hopping around to the back to open the rear van gate for the bags. Nan beholds the house for the first time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh; Muffy... Rob pulls the pick-up right behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they come in with their bags.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, there's an awful lot to be done with this place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You sound as if you own it. She helps with bags, shepherding them on ahead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will, if all goes well. Next month when I turn 21. It's my first- stage inheritance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First stage? What's your second?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Texas. You might be talking to your future boss, Harve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mom, I am home! They all look to see him standing in the entrance to the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as they follow Chaz into the room. A series of picture windows give a spectacular view of the sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, I could get real used to this.
direction.name: direction

Beneath the boathouse, floating in the water, is a grungy old skiff covered by a tarp. Skip turns away from the dock, and flicks his lighter among the weeds, finding marijuana growing there. He CACKLES with triumph. Something MOVES nearby. He doesn't pay attention, taking out his knife to cull the dried leaves. He cups them in his hand against the wind, douses his lighter, and hurries out onto the dock to the boathouse entrance to prepare his joint.

direction.raw_text: as Skip enters. It is pitch black in here, and aside from the gentle lapping sounds of water against the pilings down below O.S., all is still. Skip flips a lightswitch in the darkness and nothing happens. He edges slowly along a wall away from the door. Then he becomes aware of another living presence in the boathouse. It is a slow breathing sound--completely inhuman.

direction.raw_text: Hello? There is no answer, but the breathing continues. Then a sharp rapping sound very near, like a foot striking the wood flooring.

direction.raw_text: Who's there? Pause. No answer. We hear in the darkness the sound of his switchblade clicking open. And then he waits, straining his ears to hear. Finally, Skip reaches into his pocket, puils out his lighter and flicks it on. Something snags him from behind. Skip gasps, helpless, as a thick rope controlled by powerful, shadowed hands tightens around his neck. His knife, dried leaves and lighter cascade to the floor.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (turning to her; gently) What about you? What about your future? You're the one with the four point. (DEJECTED) ...maybe it's crazy--you investing so much energy in me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I'm scared. I don't know if I want what Mom and everybody else expects of me. I don't want to go to law school.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got a great mind
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...only it's not made up. Smiling sadly, he crosses to her, puts his arms around her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Great... Do you realize how perfectly unmatched we are?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's made up about one thing though.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah? What's that? She looks up and kisses him softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you feel the same about me a year from now? Two years, five years from now? She takes his hand and leads him down the pier and into the boathouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As they come inside. Kit closes the door, and immediately they are in each other's arms. The surging waves swirl beneath them, visible through the shrunken floorboards. Rob and Kit stretch out. All the passion, all the tenderness, all the intensity makes them oblivious to the fact that something is moving on the water below... And when Kit finally opens her eyes to it, Skip's face bulges gruesomely up at her through the slatted floor! Kit screams and scrambles to her feet--Rob completely uncomprehending until he sees it too: Skip's body, pale and bloodied, draped within the grungy skiff passing beneath them on the waves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the time he pulls on his swimsuit and comes rushing out with Kit, however, Rob's shock has turned to rage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skip! You sonofabitch! But there's no response, Skip's body unmoving on the self-powered skiff which continues bobbing out to sea.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: starts to wonder whether it really is a joke. He hurries forward, plunging 'into the water to reach the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skip... Skip! But it's too far and getting farther, and the waves are too strong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JOHN HOUSE - DAY Rob and Kit come struggling up the path. Chaz trains his videopak on them from the porch . He, Arch, Harvey and Nikki unwind with beer and sandwiches after their sweaty workout.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (commentary while he tapes) Respectable young Quaker couple returning after quiet afternoon of nonviolent sex.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, how was it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Skip? Anybody seen him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who wants to know?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Goddammit, can't you give me a straight answer! They sit up with the force. Nan comes out on the porch, hearing .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We saw him... on a boat... drifting by the pier. He wasn't movinq. He looked dead... unless he was joking...!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, if it was Skip...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I saw his face!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has anybody seen him since last night? They all realize they haven't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont .) Jesus Christ... Rob turns, rushing into the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob stops as he notices, near the foot of the stairs where he'd parked it upon first entering the house yesterday afternoon, Skip's overnight bag. He turns and bounds up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob runs down to Skip's door and flings it open. A cheap rubber hobgoblin drops suddenly in front of him, suspended from the ceiling on frail, metal springs. Rob jumps back with a startled cry, then angrily tears the thing out of his way and throws it down. This is the last of Muffy's little April Fool's gags, and as with the overnight bag, it signifies that Skip has been nowhere near this room. But Rob steps inside and looks around just to make sure. The room is untouched, the bed unslept in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . PORCH - DAY Rob hurries out, as Muffy finally appears, emerging from the wooded grounds, basketful of mushrooms in hand. She approaches.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (noticing their distress ) Something wrong? Rob rushes by her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! I'll go with you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me too!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Rob, Arch and Chaz come running down to the water. They stop and look around, seeing nothing. No answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (aloud: for Skip) Hey, asshole!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute! Look at this! He has found on the little pebbled beach beside the dock, Skip's switchblade. It is in pieces. There's blood on the broken blade.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This was Skip's.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you think? That guy on the ferry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. I don't know what to think.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I say we go looking for him, him or Skip. One of them's bound to still be around... somewhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean split up?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's not take any chances. He was... He was pretty big.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No sucker's taken me yet. He rips a loose board off the dock for a club.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the gathering twilight, Muffy puts the basket of mushrooms away on a shelf. Someone grabs her wrist. She gasps. It's Nan. Nan steps from the shadows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know why you're avoiding me... (DISTRAUGHT) I guess it's your idea of a joke... that's why you invited me. How'd you find out? From one of his preppy 'friends'? Who else have you told?... Who else knows, except the father!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I... don't know what you're talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh? The tape just got there? You know very well... my abortion! She comes apart, in tears. Muffy stares, uncomprehending.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont.) I thought you wanted to be friends... you think you can play with people's feelings just because you're rich and can do what you want. Well, you can't...! She rushes out the rear door. Muffy tries to recover, confused. She continues on to the back entrance to the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swinging open the door, she almost runs into Harvey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry... I was just checkin' to make sure everybody was all right. He beats a hasty retreat the other way, passing Nikki on her way in Nikki raises an eyebrow at Muffy, misinterpreting the tension in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey? No kidding'? Maybe that explains your clothes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What d'you, mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, c'mon. Muffy exits hurriedly, upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The path is narrow and tortuous . Arch uses his club to clear the way, trying to follow its twists and turns. He also tries to make vocal contact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, shithead! chickendick!... yeah, you! Skip! He moves deeper and deeper into the forest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up ahead on the pathway a thick, black viper slithers out of the undergrowth, stops, sensing Arch's presence, and coils itself against his approach.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Arch stalks forward, not looking at the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skip! Arch steps right over the snake and continues on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as Arch hears a noise. He stops. SOMEONE ELSE is here with him, very nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skip? He turns and moves back along the trail, peering into the dense foliage on either side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he steps over the snake again going back the other way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stops again, looks all around him, then turns once more and starts to move very slowly with short little steps back in the other direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Skip?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is edging closer and closer to the snake. He is bound to step on it this time. The snake coils itself to strike. Arch's foot comes down just missing it, less than six inches away, when suddenly the ground seems to move. A noose springs up, tightens around his ankle, and Arch is lifted into the air upside down, swinging wildly, dropping his club. Now the viper strikes, and Arch sees it. He is shrieking with horror as he tries to bat the creature away from him. But he keeps swinging into it, and the snake keeps striking at him, trying to find an opening. Suddenly a long, gleaming blade ENTERS FRAME and chops the snake in two. Arch looks up, his face white and frozen into a mask of sheer terror, no longer able even to scream
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kit, Nikki and Harvey are waiting on the back porch when Rob emerges from the woods nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (calling to him) No Skip? Chaz now comes out of the woods on the other side of the yard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No luck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Arch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He isn't with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like this... I definitely don't think I like this...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think it's about time we called the police. The screen door BANGS again. They look up. It's Muffy. She returns their stares stiffly, without expression . She holds flowers cut with hand shears.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eight-two-four-eight. Constable Potter has an office at his home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think we should wait any longer... Rob moves into the house past Muffy. Kit follows him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to be played like Muffy) Who wants some tea? (BEAT) It'll calm our nerves... She exits toward the kitchen . Nikki. perplexed by her behavior, looks strangely after her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GROUNDS OF HOUSE - LATE AFTERNOON Nan sits alone on a stone bench beside a small Buddha statue in a secluded corner of the garden behind the house. She has been weeping. Her face tells the story. Now a gentle wind springs up rustling the leaves of the thick bushes surrounding her. She looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOM  SUNSET Rob is on the phone trying to reach the Constable. He hangs up the receiver, then lifts it and starts to dial again. Kit, standing beside him. now wanders silently off into the dining room .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Kit enters, Muffy comes in from the pantry, breathless and apologetic, her hands full of tea boxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't know what kind anybody would like so I just... got them all...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me help.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Has he reached the Constable?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob? No, we haven 't been able to get through to the mainland yet. Muffy eases. Kit turns the tap to fill the kettle. The pipes begin to
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The tap sputters and coughs out a spurt of brown water before running dry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... the main... it's probably broken.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No water? Nikki and Harvey enter, having heard the pipes banging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's happening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It happens sometime... But there's still the well all the island homes have some kind of pump... or well... for emergencies. Nikki reaches for a large flashlight beam.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus. I'll go. Just point me in the right direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not without me. Harvey accompanies Nikki out the back door, leaving Kit and Muffy alone again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (bearing up under Kit's stare) I'm not worried. I'm sure those two... Skip and Art... they're just up to some kind of stupid trick . . . Kit moves out of the kitchen uneasily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki milkes ghost sound8, following Harvey out through the dark. It makes him nervous.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think you should really do that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that it? The well is the old-fashioned kind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont.) Boy, when she said `well,' she really meant 'well'. who dug this thing? Pocahontas? She reaches for the wooden bucket attached by metal nook to the thick rope. Harvey pre-empts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, let me do it. I've probably had more experience than you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean, back home on the farm?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you think I'm a hick, but I'd like to change your mind about that, if you'd only give me the chance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because, I'd really like to plow your field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Draw me some water. He's glad to oblige, opening the hinged wood well cover and lowering the bucket slowly. The dark hole seems to go on forever. Suddenly, there's a muffled CLATTER deep within the well.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Aw, crap...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What happened?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I lost the bucket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hal. The rope was rotten, any fool coulda seen that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, shine your light down so I can get a fix on it. She rises on her toes, flashing the powerful beam down the dank hole. Harvey bends over to look. A rotted piece of the well cover breaks off in his hand. He lurches forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh... oh, Jesus! He slams back in ashen horror.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...what...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay back! Don't look!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm a big girl now. I think I can handle a few spiders and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She shines the beam down again, bending in for a look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She should've listened to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nan's body lies twisted and jammed among the slime. Her dress is torn, revealing a white breast with veins of blood streaming across it and into the water. Next to her, Arch's severed head gapes up in a rictus grin, joined in its leer by Skip's decapitated head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's like the very guts have been torn out of her. She screams, stumbling back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . WELL  DUSK as Rob runs up, everyone else is already there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What is it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't want to know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the well ! Oh, God, the well! Rob grabs the flashlight from Chaz's hands and leaps up to take a look. After a long, horrifying glimpse he has to step back to control his overwhelming nausea. He shudders violently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have to leave, all of us, we have to get away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (closing the well cover) We can't get away. Everyone back into the house . Now. (JUMPING DOWN) Let's go!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looking in through the windows we can see Rob alone in the living room still trying the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: NING ACROSS to the dining room windows, we see Nikki seated at the table with Kit and Chaz on either side of her. Harvey stands behind them against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kit is trying to comfort Nikki who is still in shock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's okay, Nikki. With the others... they were outdoors. But we're inside now, and we're safe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all because of what happened on the ferry, isn't it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It was an accident. Don't they know that? Muffy enters from the kitchen with a glass of water. Harvey pulls her quietly aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muffy, where do you keep your guns?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Guns? We don't keep guns in this house. The others turn and look back at them. There is an uncomfortable pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (handing Nikki the glass) Here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, God! Not the water!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all right. It's Perrier. Suddenly the phone rings O. S. They all look toward the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...as Rob snatches up the receiver.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello! He listens for a moment, then almost collapses with relief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont.) Constable Potter... Thank God it's you... The others stand and start drifting in from the dining room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Constable Potter is calling from a pay phone near the reception desk. He listens for a moment, then ...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you talking about? (LISTENS) That ain't possible . (LISTENS) And I'm telling you, I'm here at the hospital now visiting Buck. He came out of surgery last night--It might interest you to know he'll be all right-- and Cal's been here too, the whole time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: WIDENS to reveal the ferryman Cal standing anxiously beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOM  NIGHT Rob looks like he's just been clubbed on the back of the head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Constable?... (LISTENS) Here. She's all right. (LISTENS) With Muffy? What do you mean? He looks up at the others who have gathered around him expectantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, all right... Please... Please hurry. He hangs up. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (anything, but jubilant) He's on his way. We're supposed to wait here... to stay together...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about the ferryman?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It isn't him. They've been together all day.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand. They look at each other ominously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't either. (BEAT) He's going to send up a flare as he's nearing the dock. Then we're to go down as a group to meet him there. (MOVING AWAY) In the meantime... we just wait. He goes out of the living room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob bolts and double-locks the front door. He also fastens the chain just for good measure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: & DINING ROOMS - NIGHT Chaz and Nikki secure all the doors and windows to the outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kit enters, checks and locks the windows. She turns on the lamp. On the desk -- prominently displayed and catching her eye -- a FRAMED PHOTOGRAPH.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a black-and-white picture, probably Muffy as a child. But what's confusing is there's another little girl next to her in the picture, who looks just like Muffy, too...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...doesn't understand. She glances at the walls for more pictures. Muffy enters suddenly, interrupting her. Kit startles, turning. They face each other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's my father's study.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I just came in to make sure everything was secure to lock the windows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good idea. Sometimes... with the tides... it can take someone all night to get here from the mainland... and even then, sometimes they don't make it...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Harvey is unlocking his suitcase which is back up on the bed. He reaches in and pulls out a small revolver. He drops the cylinder, checking to see that it's loaded, then snaps it back in place. He tucks the weapon into the waistband at the small of his back, then slips on his navy blazer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .NIGHT No one is around and no one has been down here since earlier in the day when Muffy apparently brought down the painting with the vacant eye-holes from outsid~ Rob and Kit's bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S off the painting, now hung on a blank wall, to the transcan window which is still propped open to the outside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LIVING ROOH  NIGHT Chaz, Nikki, Kit and Harvey are here, trying to wait it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (peering out the window) What's taking him so long?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly; without conviction) It could be the tides.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait a minute. Aren't we supposed to be staying together? Where're Muffy and Rob?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob's checking the back of the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And Muffy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's been acting less than normal anyway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (picking up on it) What do you mean?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean all day and you haven't noticed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, who isn't?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and those nurse's shoes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What nurse's shoes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The clodhoppers she's been wearing today... crepe soles... It's as though some common nerve of suspicion has been touched. They all stir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She was arguing with Nan in the hall, before you and Rob... before you came back alone. They turn full attention on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About something Nan found in her room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Something about an abortion. They all pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I found somethin"g in my room, too She reaches into her bag and pulls out the black rubber bondage hood.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...only I don't think it was intended for me .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Chaz; defending Nikki) And What did you find?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I didn't find anything.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're supposed to believe that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right. (TRUMPING HIM) I spent the night with Nikki. (BEAT) What about you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your little secret?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know What you're talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, come on, sport. I walked in on you last night , and you were acting like your ass was on fire...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't anything... Just some clippings... of some car accidents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing personal in that, I suppose?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Who hasn't been in a car accident? It's a common thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I haven't. There is a slight pause. Rob comes into the living room, holding a flashlight and stands just inside the doorway. The others shift uncomfortably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What I'd like to know is, how did Muffy find out about these things and why -- ?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it! Just stop it all of you! (BEAT) What is wrong with us? Nhat happened to all our talk about friendship, and undying loyalty? (looking from one to the other) Do you know what we're saying? That we're actually sitting here discussing the possibility that Muffy, a generous friend, has invited us all here to -- She stops suddenly, freezing in mid-sentence, and they all turn, following the direction of her look, to see Muffy standing in the entryway behind Rob.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm going upstairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muffy? We should all stay together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my house. (BEAT) I'll be in my room. She turns and heads up the stairs. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's got a point. (STANDING) We're starting to get on each other's nerves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As long as we all stay within shouting distance of each other...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You coming? He joins her, and they quietly head for the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm goinq to find the way up to the attic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure we can watch for the Constable better from up there. Kit hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's all right. I can keep watch on the stairs. Rob ho1ds out his hand to her. She takes it and they walk together toward the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muffy enters, closes the door quietly and locks it behind her. She crosses to her bed, slowly sits down and loses herself in troubled thought about everything that is going on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . MAIN STAIRWAY  NIGHT Harvey steps up to the halfway landing and sits down. He looks above, looks below, then opens a magazine and begins thumbing through it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki's suitcase is open on the bed, and she is moving nervously about the room, gathering her things and cramming them into it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki, come on...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you mean, Nikki, come on? Don't give me any of this Nikki, come on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, stay if you like. Lock your door. Dig a trench. Hang out. But once I leave this place, I'm never coming back. She walks out the door, and Chaz follows her to...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They cross the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (catching up to her) We're all supposed to stay together here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, that's been real effective... She goes into...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...and starts to collect all her stuff from in here. Chaz comes in behind her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So what are you going to do? Just waltz on down to the pier. By yourself. Check your bag with the porter. Then wait for an ocean liner to happen by and pick you up. Is that it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pushing past him) I can't stay here any longer. She goes back out into the hallway. Chaz follows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as they cross back to Nikki's bedroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What if the Constable never even comes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then I'll swim all the way back to the mainland... I can be strong if I have to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as they re-enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, just relax--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three people are dead and you're telling me to relax?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki, now just hold on a minute, and look at me. Look at me. She stops and looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Now, am I nervous? Yes. Maybe even a little bit scared? Yes. Am I running around like a chicken with its head cut off?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nice image.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No. (BEAT) I mean, come on, babe. Lighten up a little, huh? He quickly slips the S&M mask over his head, clowning around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) (MUFFLED) Look at this. What, me worry?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very funny, Chaz.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've got to look on the bright side of things. Everything'll be all right... Huh? Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be a jerk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. Now I'm turning you on. Right?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take that thing off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why? I kind of like it in here. (moving blindly toward her) Kiss me, you savage she-devil.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Get out of here. She pushes him and he falls backward across the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooooh, stop it some more. I love it when you're rough. She turns and goes out of the room again. Chaz remains lying across the bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Course it would help a little if I could breathe in here. For when things start to get really passionate. (BEAT) Nikki?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: the open bedroom window for a beat. The curtains luff slightly in response to a gentle breeze wafting in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki comes down the hall with some more clothes on her arm. She arrives at her door, opens it (she had not closed it the last time she went out), and goes inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chaz is still lying across the bed as last seen, except that now his hands cover his crotch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Real subtle, Chaz. She continues packing, moving around the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (CONT.) Now I'm supposed to throw off my clothes and jump on you? Just wind her up and watch her go? You've got a lot to learn, buddy. No response. Chaz lies perfectly still. Not even his chest appears to be moving.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking at his crotch again) What is this? Show and tell? (BEAT) I'll show you mine if you show me yours? (BEAT) Well, forget it... You may as well just stick it back in your pants. (BEAT) Chaz?... Chaz? (NO ANSWER) Say something, goddammit! She swats his hands away from his crotch. Beneath them, on his pants, is a slowly growing blood stain. Nikki gasps, her mouth contorting into a scream that will not come. She turns suddenly in response to .a NOISE O.S., and sees a DARK FIGURE stepping out from behind the slowly closing bedroom door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . ATTIC STAIRS - NIGHT It is almost pitch black. O.S. there is the sound of a lightswitch being flicked on and off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) No lights. Suddenly a flashlight beam pierces the darkness, and Rob and Kit can now be seen ascending the stairs to the attic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...as they arrive at the top. Rob sweeps the one large room with her flashlight. Piles of old furniture are stacked here and there, covered with grimy sheets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No one's been up here in years. Rob crosses to the garret windows overlooking the sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can you see him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . There must not be a light on the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Or... he's chosen not to use it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kit? He said something else on the phone, about Muffy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He said not to trust anybody. That's why we were to stay together. No one was to be left alone with anyone else... Then he said, especially not with Muffy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So that's why you let her go upstairs?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's why I let her go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What did he mean by that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. He wouldn't explain it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But that's ridiculous...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is it? He's known her longer than we have. He sweeps the flashlight back toward the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob, wait a minute. What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where? She takes the flashlight from him and aims it on something near the door--the Barbie and Ken dolls from the previous night's dinner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's just the dolls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's been up here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So? She moves toward them while Rob stays by the windows looking out. As she gets closer to the dolls, however, Kit realizes that they have not just been stuck there haphazardly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob? Rob comes over to join her as we CUT TO:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of the dolls as the flashlight moves across them, slowly revealing them one by one. The last to be seen are a Barbie and the heads of two Kens stuck in a bowl of water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: KlT staring at them, frightened and astonished.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Jesus...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob? . . .
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's Arch and Skip and Nan.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait... He takes the flashlight from her and reveals two more: a Barbie and a Ken lying next to each other with no clothes on, both of them splattered with bright red nail polish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are these other two? Suddenly the room is flooded with light. Rob turns sharply and sees outside the window the Constable's flare hanging in the night sky.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's here! O.S. there is a PISTOL SHOT from downstairs. Kit screams.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on! He jumps to his feet, grabs hold of her hand and pulls her with him out of the attic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as they come racing down from the attic. Rob heads for the main staircase...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hal! ...while Kit runs down the hall to Nikki's room and flings open the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nikki? She isn't there. Kit backs into the hallway. Downstairs O.S. she can hear Rob moving about, calling for Harvey, but up here all is quiet and threatening. She hurries silently down to Chaz' room, opens the door and steps inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is dark again in here, but the video camera is still operating. Kit closes the door behind her and leans forward, barely whispering...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Chaz?... Nikki?... She turns on the light and sees the bed, both beds: they are drenched in blood. Kit reaches for the doorknob. It comes off in her hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob!!! She's frantically pounding on the door and trying to jam the doorknob back in, to get it to work. There's a NOISE outside the window. She turns aghast. Suddenly the door flies open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I can't find Hal-- He stops in mid-sentence as he sees the beds. Kit is already through the door. Rob follows her out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . - NIGHT Rob is running with her toward the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob, what about Muffy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's my friend! She breaks away from him and dashes down to Muffy's door. Rob has no choice but to follow her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muffy! Muffy!! She tries the door, but it's locked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (pulling her away) Let's go. Rounding the corner to the shadowy back stairs, Rob suddenly bumps into something, someone there. He screams aloud, dropping his flashlight. It is Harvey. His body dangles from the rafters high above the top of the rear stairs, a thick rope around his neck. Now Rob has become unnerved, and it is Kit's turn to take the lead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This way! And they head back toward the main staircase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . -- NIGHT The flarelight wanes. Constable Potter looks up anxiously. Soon he will be waiting in darkness . (Unlike the previous night's scene, now there are no outdoor lights on here.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob and Kit burst out of the dining room as if the house were on fire. Kit stops to pull the doors shut behind them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (yanking her away) Forget the doors! Within moments they have crossed the back yard and disappeared into the brush leading down to the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The night is a landscape of terror. As Rob and Kit race through the darkness, the forest seems to fold in on top of them, completely enclosing them within itself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They arrive at the water's edge and slow down abruptly. Though they can see Potter's boat rocking gently in the water, moored to the dock, they cannot make out any sign of the Constable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (in guarded approach) Constable... Mr. Potter? No answer. The silence is chilling. They proceed out onto the dock. They come to the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If there's another flare, we can signal him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe he went on to the house. Rob unlashes the mooring, grabbing hold of the line to pull the boat in. It won't budge, the line snagged in the water where it dips in. Rob tugs harder, freeing something to the surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is Constable Potter, his body turning once before sinking again under its tethered weights. An animal cries out behind them. Rob wastes no more time, pulling the rope and the boat quickly toward them. They jump in. There is a flashlight in the toolbox. Rob grabs it, shining it onto the controls. But there's no key in the ignition, and no other way to start it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit... no key! Kit, meanwhile, picks up the LETTER that's lying on the bottom of the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob! He turns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont.) Look! She presses it into his hands. He shines the flashlight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Its waterstained, but still legible... The letterhead reads, 'STATE HOSPITAL FOR THE CRIMINALLY INSANE,' and it is dated 'MARCH 31,' addressed to Potter, and reads:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Pursuant to our previous communication, please be advised that the patient under discussion has still not been found and returned to custody, and it now believed to be attempting to return to her home in your jurisdiction. If encountered, exercise extreme caution and notify us immediately, as Miss St. John has been a patient here for three years and is still considered incorrigibly unstable and extremely dangerous..." Kit looks up, frantic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Miss .St. John? What's it talking about? Muffy hasn't been in any state mental institution for the last three years -- she's been at Vassar!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... but we've gotta get this boat started.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The house. Didn't Muffy say there was another key back in the kitchen?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got no choice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob, I really don't want to go back there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit. Another pause. Neither one is making the move to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd have you stay here, but--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Listen, Kit, we'll get out of here, I promise you. We've been through so much together... She has started to cry softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont.) ...it isn't going to end here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay. He kisses her. Pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go. Brief pause, then he turns to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit... They move slowly off the dock.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob and Kit move up to the shrubbery skirting the back lawn and gaze across at the house. It is completely dark within and remains wrapped in silence as before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob, look! The doors. They've been closed. Sure enough, the doors they come out by minutes ago, the ones they didn't stop to close, are now shut tight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on. They move stealthily through the bushes around to the side of the house. They stop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There. He is pointing toward the open basement window across a thirty foot space of clear lawn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's how we're going in. Kit swallows hard. She nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you with me? They break from their cover and run, keeping low, to the side of the house. Rob peers through the window into the darkness inside , pushes the transom all the way open, and then drags himself through on his belly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He drops to the floor, turning to give Kit a hand. She enters the same, dusting herself off next to him. Rob turns on the flashlight, using it cautiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (moving through darkness) The stairs... Where are the stairs?...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that? They pause, hearing
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in the darkness , comi ng from the depths of the utility room. Rob leads the way, cautiously, toward the sound.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . UTILITY ROOM The flashlight cuts through the dark, revealing the tap DRIPPING in the tub. Before, the tub was clean. NOW, however, stubborn crimson STAINS smear the basin, like blood that has refused to be washed away. Other stains darken the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kit's eyes widen in growing horrow. Rob turns the beam toward the stains that track across the floor, following them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The trail leads out of the utility room to the large, cast-iron incinerator. Rob steps forward, slowly opening its door, angling the beam inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Inside, Muffy's characteristic attire -- the clothes we saw her wearing yesterday after their arrival -- lie stuffed inside, bloodied and charred.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Muffy's clothes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't get it. The beam momentarily sweeps the wall next to Kit. She sees something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (an urgent whisper) Rob! She gets him to turn the beam back to the wall where she is. She helps train it on what she saw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a growth chart that has been marked in ink faded over the years. There are growth measurements for 'MUFFY'... and for a child named 'BUFFY"... with similar heights on similar dates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She gasps, finally connecting it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, god... oh no!... He doesn't yet understand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...the picture of the girls in the study... the letter... what the Constable was trying to tell you... It's not Muffy it's her twin sister, Buffy! She has a twin sister! Rob's eyes have a glazed look. They are fixed somewhere else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob, don't you see? (BEAT) Rob? She follows his look and sees, on the wall near the growth chart, that he has trained his flashlight beam on the eyeless portrait from the night before. Only now, there are REAL EYES BEHIND THE PAINTING, STARING OUT AT THEM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rob! He casts about for a weapon, coming up with a length of lead pipe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull it away...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (too frightened to move) Rob?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pull it away! They advance together on the painting, Rob keeping his flashlight on the eyes the entire time. Kit slowly reaces out, lifts the painting from the wall and drops it, jumping back... just as MUFFY'S HEAD rolls forward from a shelf behind the painting, right into Kit's lap! Kit screams as she bobbles the head in her hands like a hot potato, trying to get rid of it. Suddenly a loud NOISE slams at the basement window. Rob grabs Kit, covering her mouth and snapping off .the flashlight. The head falls to the. floor at their feet. They turn...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...just in time to see the window they entered being nailed shut from the outside. All else they can make out are Buffy's hands and her tell-tale nurse shoes. Then these two move of sight around the outside of the house.
direction.name: direction
